snippet: President Obama, speaking in Malaysia, where he met with children who had fled violence, said the United States should not close itself to the world’s refugees out of fear.
abstract: Pres Obama vows, during overseas trip to Turkey and Asia, that American borders will remain open to international refugees, especially children; American politicians and Republican presidential candidates react critically to statement; legislation has been approved, with bipartisan support, for increase in screening process for Middle Eastern and African refugees, particularly those from Syria, seeking asylum in United States.
lead_paragraph: President Obama, speaking in Malaysia, where he met with children who had fled violence, said the United States should not close itself to the world’s refugees out of fear.

headline.main: Refugees Must Not Be Turned Away, Obama Says
headline.print_headline: Obama Vows to Keep Doors Open for Refugees
